Allows an app to receive periodic updates of your activity level from Google, for example, if you are walking, driving, cycling or stationary.
Added to favourites
Opt out of Ads Personalisation
Instruct apps not to use your advertising ID to build profiles or show you personalised ads.

You will still see ads, but they may not be based on your interests.

Note that if you clear your cache, you will lose your opt-out setting.
This will clear your current %s across Google, including Google Maps, Google Now and Google Search.
This will update your %s across Google, including Google Maps, Google Now and Google Search.

"Activity recognition allows apps and services to receive regular updates from Google on your current activity. For example, Google can determine if you’re walking, driving, cycling or stationary.
If high accuracy is turned off, device sensors such as the accelerometer will be used to detect activity.
Sensor and audio data are never recorded or shared with Google or apps."
Activity recognition High accuracy mode

This account requires Screen Lock security. Would you like to start again with a different account?

To complete setup, "Android Device Policy app will be downloaded on your device.

This device has been set up to be managed by your organisation.
"This account couldn't be accessed. Make sure that your device is following your organisation's security policies. If you keep seeing this error, contact your organisation's admin."
" Your domain requires mobile device management. Install the \"Google Apps Device Policy\" app to enforce the security policies required by the "^1 account.
" The account "^1 must be added to a device or work profile administered by your organisation. Please follow the instructions provided by your IT admin in order to complete this.
Invalid character. Only 0-9, a-z, A-Z and full stops are allowed.
"The text you have typed isn't a valid username."

By continuing, you agree that this device may also automatically download and install updates and apps from Google, your operator and this device’s manufacturer, possibly using mobile data. Some of these apps may offer in-app purchases. You can remove these apps at any time.
Free up space when device storage is almost full by removing some data from this device, like backed-up photos and videos.
Automatically back up device data (such as Wi‑Fi passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps) to your child’s Google Drive.

"When you turn on automatic backup, device and app data is periodically saved to a private folder in your child’s Google Drive. ^1
Backup data will not count towards your child’s Drive storage quota. Large files or files developers have chosen to exclude from the service will not be backed up."
Automatically back up device data (such as Wi‑Fi passwords, SMS and call history), settings and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps) to your child’s Google Drive.

As a parent, you can turn these services on or off at any time for your child’s account. Data will be used according to Google’s policies".
If you want to find out more, you can tap each service."
Use Google’s location service to help apps determine your child’s location. Anonymous location data will be sent to Google when this device is on.

"Google’s location service uses sources like Wi‑Fi and mobile networks to help estimate this device’s location faster and more accurately. This service is active when this device’s Location setting is on and in a mode that uses Wi‑Fi or mobile networks to estimate location, such as the High accuracy or Battery saving (Power saving) mode.
You can turn this service off by:
"
turning off the main Location setting on this device;"
"
leaving the main Location setting on and selecting a mode that uses GPS only, sometimes called Device only.

Help improve your Android experience by automatically sending diagnostic and device and app usage data to Google. This won’t be used to identify your child and will help improve battery life, app stability, network connectivity and more.

"This is general information about this device and how it’s used (such as battery level, app usage and network connectivity). The data will be used to improve Google’s products and services for everyone. Some aggregated information will help partners, such as Android developers, make their apps and products better, too.
Turning off this feature doesn’t affect this device’s ability to send the information needed for essential services such as system updates and security."
You typed an incorrect password or your account has changed. Re-type your password. If you forgot your password and need to recover your account click here.
This could be a temporary problem or your Android device may not be provisioned for data services. Try again when connected to a mobile network or connect to a Wi-Fi network.
"If you forget your password or you're signing in from a new device or location, you may be asked for one or both of these codes to help protect your Google account."
"These codes expire 15 minutes from now or after they're used. You should only use them on web pages with URLs that start with 'https://accounts.google.com/'."
Retype password
Start Again
Account added

By continuing, you agree that this device may also automatically download and install updates and apps from Google, your operator and your device’s manufacturer, possibly using mobile data. Some of these apps may offer in-app purchases. You can remove these apps at any time.
You also hereby consent and grant preloaded Google apps permission to access information and functions on your device. See this page for more information on usage of these permissions.
When your phone storage is almost full, free space by removing some data, like backed-up photos and videos.
Easily restore or switch phones at any time. Backup includes apps, app data and device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords).
App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos.

"^1
Photos and videos from this device are synced with Google Photos to search, edit, delete and share from any of your devices. By default, full resolution photos and videos are uploaded.
Backup data will not count toward your Drive storage quota."
Easily restore or switch phones at any time. Backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts and device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions).
Easily restore or switch phones at any time. Backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions), and SMS.

Easily restore or switch phones at any time. Backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts, device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions), photos, videos and SMS. Photos and videos are synced to your Google account and may be used across services.
Tap to learn more about each service, such as how to turn it on or off later. Data will be used according to Google’s Privacy Policy.

"App details including in-app purchases can be found in the Play Store. App data & settings sync to devices signed in with your Google account.
Use of instant apps is governed by the "Google Play Terms of Service". "Learn more.

"Google’s location service uses sources like Wi‑Fi and mobile networks to help estimate your device’s location faster and more accurately. This service is active when your device’s Location setting is on and in a mode that uses Wi‑Fi or mobile networks to estimate location, such as the High accuracy or Battery saving (Power saving) mode.
You can turn off this service by either:
"
turning off the main Location setting on your device;"
"
leaving the main Location setting on and selecting a mode that uses GPS only, sometimes called Device only.
If you continue, you also agree to the Google Terms of Service.
When you use this device we abide by our Privacy Policy and additional terms apply.

Help improve your Android experience by automatically sending diagnostic and device and app usage data to Google. This will help improve battery life, app stability, network connectivity and more. If you turned on additional Web & App Activity, this information will be stored with your account so that you can manage it in My Activity.

"This is general information about your device and how you use it (such as battery level, app usage and network connectivity). The data will be used to improve Google’s products and services for everyone. Some aggregated information will help partners, such as Android developers, make their apps and products better, too.
Turning off this feature doesn’t affect your device’s ability to send the information needed for essential services such as system updates and security."
Allow Google live wallpapers to respond to your location by accessing Google’s location service.

You can turn access to Google’s location service for live wallpapers on or off by going to Settings > Apps & notifications > App info. In the overflow menu, tap Show system > Live data wallpapers or Live Earth Wallpapers > Permissions.
By signing in, you agree to the Google and Additional Privacy Policies.
Sign in with your Google account:
Sign in
Account set up

Users who purchased this device:" The device manufacturer has preloaded Google apps and services without certification from Google. Contact the manufacturer and ask for a certified device. Learn more at g.co/AndroidCertifiedDevice.
"Unlicensed manufacturers:" You need a licence from Google to distribute Google apps and services. Apply at g.co/AndroidGMSContact.
"Licensed manufacturers:" To use Google apps and services during development, register the device. Contact your Google Business Development Manager for more info.
"Custom ROM users:" To use Google apps and services with a custom ROM, register this device. Learn more at g.co/apps-custom."
Authorisation dialogue
Back up app data, Wi‑Fi passwords and other settings to Google Drive

"Automatically back up device data (such as Wi-Fi passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps) remotely.
When you turn on automatic backup, device and app data is regularly saved remotely. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos."
Stop backing up your Wi‑Fi passwords, bookmarks, other settings and app data, plus delete all copies on Google Drive?
Please check your Internet connection and try again
Automatic backup ensures that you can easily restore or switch phones at any time. Find out more

"When you turn on automatic backup:
● Device settings and app data are periodically saved to a private folder in Google Drive. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos.
Large files, or files developers have chosen to exclude from the service, will not be backed up."
Photos and videos on this device sync to your Google Photos library so that you can search, edit, delete and share from any of your devices.

"To help improve your search experience, Google can store and use links, provided by apps, to content that you've visited in apps."
Find out more

"When you pause Location History, places that you go with your devices will stop being added to your Location History map. This limits functionality of some Google products over time, such as Google Maps and Google Now.
Remember, pausing this setting doesn’t delete any previous activity, but you can view and manage this information in your "Location History map.
This may change the Location mode that you’ve selected for your device. For details, go to %s.
Use Google’s Location service; as part of this service, anonymous location data will be sent to Google when your device is on.
Use GPS, Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors
Use Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors
Turn on Wi-Fi

"Google’s Location service improves location accuracy by using Wi‑Fi and mobile networks to help estimate your location. Anonymous location data will be sent to Google when your device is on.
Turning this off will result in your device only using GPS for location. This may impact the accuracy of location used by apps such as Maps and Find My Device."

"Google’s location service improves location accuracy by using Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors to help estimate your location. Google may collect location data periodically and use this data in an anonymous way to improve location accuracy and location-based services.
Turning this off will result in your device only using GPS for location. This may impact the accuracy of location used by apps such as Maps and Find My Device."

Location History helps you get useful information such as automatic commute predictions, improved search results and more useful ads on and off Google. It does this by creating a private map of where you go with your signed-in devices.

To create this map, Google regularly obtains location data from devices for which you’ve turned on Location History. This data is collected even when you aren’t using a specific Google product.

Remember, location data may be saved from any signed-in devices for which you’ve turned on Location History. You can always control and review your activity at myaccount.google.com.
Google Location Settings

"Help apps find your location more quickly and accurately using Google’s Location service. Anonymous location data will be sent to Google when your device is on.
This service is active when Location is on and High accuracy or Battery saving mode is selected."
Location may use sources like GPS, Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors to help estimate your device’s location. Anonymous location data will be sent to Google when your device is on.

Location may use sources like GPS, Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors to help estimate your device’s location. Google may collect location data periodically and use this data in an anonymous way to improve location accuracy and location-based services.

Have another device?
Copy Google accounts, apps and data from your other device

On your other device:

1. Open the Google Settings app

2. Select %1$s

3. Touch %2$s on the list and follow the on-screen instructions

On your other device:

1. Tap the All apps icon, then open the Settings app

2. Tap on Google

3. Select %1$s

4. Touch %2$s on the list and follow the on-screen instructions

"To copy:
1. Make sure that your other device is on and unlocked
2. Place the two devices back to back until you hear a tone, then set aside"
"Tap & Go uses NFC to copy your Google Accounts, apps and data from your other device. Make sure that the device's NFC is on by going to Settings."
"Don't skip"
